document_data.caption: The location of the Hanged Man (labeled 258) on a circa [[1357 DR]] map of [[Waterdeep]]
document_data.name: Hanged Man
document_data.mainbody: The '''Hanged Man''' was a tavern in the [[Waterdeep/Dock Ward|Dock Ward]] of the city of [[Waterdeep]].<ref>
document_data.Location: This tavern was located on the eastern corner of [[Pressbow Lane]] and [[Net Street (south)|Net Street]].
document_data.Structure: The Hanged Man stood only a single story tall.
document_data.Services: This tavern offered a fine selection of [[wine]]s, far better than one might suspect it to have, as well as a wide variety of [[ale]]s.
document_data.Atmosphere: The Hanged Man was often frequented by literary and artistic folk, including calligraphers, poets, scriveners, and writers. Many of whom were likely to regale their fellow patrons with tales. The clientele also had a tendency to be rude, opinionated, and smoke pipes.
